numbered_ace_sentences: 1. We noticed that younger groups are more optimistic.
2. We noticed that older groups are less optimistic.
3. We noticed that a diagonal line separates adolescents and adults.
4. We know this because there are more dots on the younger side.
5. We wonder why the selection of countries seems random.
6. We ask whether the wealth of a country affects optimism.
7. We ask how accurate the data in the graph is.
8. If the data is accurate then it is good that younger people are more optimistic.
9. Younger people are the leading generation.
10. We ask what determines the position of a dot on the x-axis.
11. We wonder why there is such a difference between age groups.
12. We ask what the leading opinions of 15-24 year-olds are.
13. We ask what the leading opinions of people who are 40 years old or older are.
14. We ask what makes some countries less optimistic than other countries.
15. We ask how the impact of the younger generation on society affects how the younger generation views the world.
16. We ask how the involvement of the younger generation in society affects how other people view the world.
17. If we rename this graph then we name it "The Optimism of the Younger Generation".
18. Max is a person.
19. Grace is a person.
20. Mac is a person.
21. Cierra is a person.
22. Max is a Wordle God.
23. Grace is a Wordle God.
24. Mac is a Wordle God.
25. Cierra is a Wordle God.
